headline: What is Map Reduce
text:
Map Reduce is a 'divide and conquer' approach to process big data, for example to find the answer to a question. When there is so much data that one processor cannot handle it alone, we have to find another way. 

In this game, each of us is going to act as a processor: we will all be a 'mapper'. Every mapper gets only a part of the data. Maybe some of us get duplicate data, but that doesn't matter. As a group of mappers, we have all the data covered.

First, we 'map': we all perform the same job on the data assigned to us, and we report our partial results to the 'reducer', the master processor. Next, the reducer does her job:  she will sort out all partial results into the final result, which is the answer to the question. 

Looks complicated, doesn't it? Let's experience it!

headline: Imagine that
text:
We want to take a holiday on a Greek island. But which island should we choose?

We would like to go to the one with the best weather! Let's check out the weather data of all the Greek islands. Only... They are so many, and all of them have so much weather data! How can we ever process all that?

Let's apply Map Reduce. Each of us will be a mapper: we will all answer a question for only a chunk of all the islands data. When we all work together, we can find our holiday destination!

headline: {question.text}
text: As a mapper, this is the question that you are going to answer for your part of the data.

The dots in the background are all the data points on all the Greek islands. A dazzling amount, don't you agree? 

Don't worry, keep scrolling!

headline: Your assigned data
text: The red dots represent the random dataset that was assigned to you. Other mappers will do other parts. Together, the mappers cover every datapoint at least once.

headline: Your turn
text: Let's begin! Mappers, it's your turn to answer the question for your part of the data. Which island, and which value, is the answer to the question?

headline: Answers from all other mappers
text: These are the answers from all the other mappers. The answers form a new dataset that is given to the reducer.

headline: Result from the reducer
text: The reducer checks out her dataset, and filters out the ultimate answer to the question. We found our holiday destination!

So you have now experience Map Reduce, and this is how it also works with computer-processors. Each one acts the same way as you did, to be a mapper in the process. Finally, the reduce-computer filters out the answer to the question.
